title: Bible (Proverbs to Apocalypse).
description: With an Oxford pledge note for the Selton Loan Chest dated 1469 and the mark of the stationer John More. There is also a note by M. Paris, possibly Master Thomas Paris of Oriel College.
Decoration: red and blue penwork initials.
genre: Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in Beinecke Library
provenanceControlled: Coates, Ronald A. Autograph. Cron, Brian S. Ownership. Millar, Eric George Bookplate.
provenanceUncontrolled: Ex libris Ronald A. Coates. Ex libris Eric Millar. Formerly owned by Brian S. Cron. Purchased from Toshiyuki Takamiya on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2017.
indexedBy: A handlist of western Medieval manuscripts in the Takamiya collection / Toshiyuki Takamiya, in The Medieval book: glosses from friends & colleagues of Christopher de Hamel, ed. by Richard Linenthal, James Marrow and William Noel. 't Goy-Houten: Hes & De Graff, 2010, pp. 421-437.
accessCondition: This material is open for research
abstract: Manuscript, on parchment, of the books of the Bible from Proverbs through the Apocalypse
